metadata.synopsis: In this scene, we’ve gone through an elaborate protocol to bring Gale back to life. He’s obviously very glad to live again, but he realises the player will have questions for him, questions he’s not actually ready to answer.
metadata.how_to_trigger: loadlevel WLD_Main_Aoe debugbook > add Gale as companionctrl+shift+k Galecinematic will trigger, accept requestLoot Gale > pull purple thread > play flute individual notes 'D' 'E' 'A' 'D' > choose option 'ach' and give scroll.> use scroll of true revival on Gale

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: My word, you did it! Ha! Oh, it's good to be alive!
16.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, glad, very relieved and happy.

3.speaker: Gale
3.text: My hands are still cold so that handshake will have to wait, but in the meantime: thank you!
3.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, glad, very relieved and happy.

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: It's a relief to be back on beautiful Faerûn. The dreariness of the Fugue Plane oppresses one's soul so very quickly.

23.speaker: Gale
23.text: That said, I assume you have some questions for me.

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: Only fair to warn you I've precious few answers to spare.

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: I apologise if that sounds thankless. It's just that some secrets simply cannot be revealed.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I've seen the darkness inside of you, remember? I already know.

59.speaker: Gale
59.text: You don't know. Not really. But after all you've done for me, I do suppose I should be at least a little bit forthcoming.

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: Tell you what: I will answer one question that you may have.
8.context: NodeContext: He tries his best to be magnanimous.

24.speaker: Gale
24.text: To the best of my ability.
24.context: NodeContext: But after being magnanimous he immediately lowers expectations. He’s not actually ready to give proper answers.

54.speaker: Gale
54.context: NodeContext: But after being magnanimous he immediately lowers expectations. He’s not actually ready to give proper answers.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I simply want to know what it is you're keeping from me.

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: I am dangerous. Not because I want to be, but because of... an error I made in the past.

75.speaker: Gale
75.text: I told you how I sought to win the favour of Mystra. I did this by trying to control a form of magic only one wizard ever could.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: I failed to control it. Instead it infested me.

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: It makes me dangerous - even in death.

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: You brought me back to life, and for that I'm in your debt, but we're surrounded by danger. It could happen again.

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: If it does, bring me back again. You must. For the sake of many.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Why did your projection say that many lives depended on your resurrection?

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: Because it was the truth, and the truth is a great motivator.

65.speaker: Gale
65.text: When I told you I need powerful magic to keep my condition under control, I didn't tell you why. Well, here's part of the why:

45.speaker: Player
45.text: The darkness inside you, what is it?

58.speaker: Gale
58.text: It is magic  from another time and another place. It is something that is beyond me, yet inside me.

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: That makes me dangerous - even in death.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Actually, never mind. If it makes you this uncomfortable, I won't insist.

17.speaker: Gale
17.text: That's... Well, that's very kind of you. If the roles were reversed I don't know if I'd have your patience.

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: There's no knowledge in a glimpse of darkness. My secrets are still my own.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: You told me you trusted me. Here's your chance to prove it.

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: I did say that. And I did mean it. And I do suppose that after all you've done for me, I should be at least a little bit forthcoming.

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: I do trust you. But some things... Some things are kept in the dark for good reason.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I brought you back to life. A few answers is the least you can spare me.

70.speaker: Gale
70.text: I... I suppose that after all you've done for me, I should be at least a little bit forthcoming.

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: And yet, there's too much a few answers could undo...

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I will have answers or I will put you in the ground myself.

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: I think I've already proven I take my secrets to the grave.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Tell me, or this'll be a very short-lived return.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You know what? It's fine. You will tell me when you're ready.

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: Now, I believe adventure awaits. Or misadventure, perhaps. Shall we?
73.context: NodeContext: twinkle in his eye at the prospect

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Now that you're back with us, there's something else I wanted to discuss.

14.speaker: Gale
14.text: Nothing would give me greater pleasure. What's the subject of the day?

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'd like to point out that if anything, your protocol was a bloody nuisance.

32.speaker: Gale
32.text: But a necessary one! Scrolls of True Resurrection don't grow on trees, you know.

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: Yes, I was afraid you'd say that.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I could hardly leave you there to rot. You'd have blown up and taken me with you.

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: Quite. And I must say - I'm glad you've taken my plight to heart. I see my trust in you was most excellently placed.
